title: Castle Rock S1E05 Explained
author: Think Story
comment: I wait the whole week for a new episode of castle rock and one from you.
I figure these videos are a lot of work and the fact you are doing it at all is great. So a few days late is more than understandable. :)

The scene where The Kid enters the house and sees the birthday party becoming a massacre is one of the most powerful scenes I've seen in television, to the point I had actual chills. The fact we could only hear what was happening made the whole thing incredibly effective. I didn't think it was a flashback of his childhood, but more that The Kid was using his powers kinda like he did to Zalewski. Which doesn't make me think he's evil at all! If he did make the family tear apart, his expression at

Your analysis is the best! What's your process in dissecting each episode? Maybe after the season wraps up you can give us a bonus analysis on how this story compares to other King stories? Thank for the work!
I find it interesting that before the wardens suicide and before Ruth’s attempted suicide that dogs bark. I wonder what that symbolizes.
description:
I delve into season one, episode five of Castle Rock "Harvest" and look at the hidden details, mysteries, easter eggs and Stephen King references.
